abstract: Media deals may be all the rage these days, but some analysts are seeing fodder for potential takeovers in the software industry as well. Kirk Materne and Daniel Cummins of Bank of America ran the numbers and found eight big software companies with low-enough stock values to make them attractive takeover candidates, even if the acquirer shelled out a 25 percent premium to the current price. The analysts emphasized they had no reason to believe a specific deal for any of them was in the works, but they also argued that consolidation in the software industry looked “inevitable.”
